00060 // Uncomment this to enable wchar_t mode 
00061 // #define XML_WCHAR_MODE 
00062  
00063 // Uncomment this to disable XPath 
00064 // #define XML_NO_XPATH 
00065  
00066 // Uncomment this to disable STL 
00067 // Note: you can't use XPath with XML_NO_STL 
00068 // #define XML_NO_STL 
00069  
00070 // Uncomment this to disable exceptions 
00071 // Note: you can't use XPath with XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
00072 // #define XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
00073  
00074 // Set this to control attributes for public classes/functions, i.e.: 
00075 // #define PHYS_LIB __declspec(dllexport) // to export all public symbols from DLL 
00076 // #define PHYS_LIB __declspec(dllimport) // to import all classes from DLL 
00077 // #define PHYS_LIB __fastcall // to set calling conventions to all public functions to fastcall 
00078 // In absence of PHYS_LIB/PHYS_LIB definitions PHYS_LIB is used instead 
00079  
00080 #endif

00083 #define _H

00091         struct bidirectional_iterator_tag;

00093 #ifdef __SUNPRO_CC 
00094         // Sun C++ compiler has a bug which forces template argument names in forward declarations to be the same as in actual definitions 
00095         template <class _T> class allocator; 
00096         template <class _charT> struct char_traits; 
00097         template <class _charT, class _Traits> class basic_istream; 
00098         template <class _charT, class _Traits> class basic_ostream; 
00099         template <class _charT, class _Traits, class _Allocator> class basic_string; 
00100 #else 
00101         // Borland C++ compiler has a bug which forces template argument names in forward declarations to be the same as in actual definitions 
00102         template <class _Ty> class allocator; 
00103         template <class _Ty> struct char_traits; 
00104         template <class _Elem, class _Traits> class basic_istream; 
00105         template <class _Elem, class _Traits> class basic_ostream; 
00106         template <class _Elem, class _Traits, class _Ax> class basic_string; 
00107 #endif 
00108  
00109         // Digital Mars compiler has a bug which requires a forward declaration for explicit instantiation (otherwise type selection is messed up later, producing link errors) 
00110         // Also note that we have to declare char_traits as a class here, since it's defined that way 
00111 #ifdef __DMC__ 
00112         template <> class char_traits<char>; 
00113 #endif 
00114 } 
00115 #endif

00163         /// @brief The character type used the internals of the XML parser, this is defined in datatypes.h. 
00164         typedef Character char_t; 
00165

00173 // The PugiXML namespace 
00174 
00175 namespace phys
00176 { namespace xml
00177 { 
00178         // Tree node types 
00179         enum NodeType 
00180         { 
00181                 NodeNull,                 // Empty (null) node handle 
00182                 NodeDocument,           // A document tree's absolute root 
00183                 NodeElement,            // Element tag, i.e. '<node/>' 
00184                 NodePcdata,             // Plain character data, i.e. 'text' 
00185                 NodeCdata,                      // Character data, i.e. '<![CDATA[text]]>' 
00186                 NodeComment,            // Comment tag, i.e. '<!-- text -->' 
00187                 NodePi,                 // Processing instruction, i.e. '<?name?>' 
00188                 NodeDeclaration,        // Document declaration, i.e. '<?xml version="1.0"?>' 
00189                 NodeDoctype             // Document type declaration, i.e. '<!DOCTYPE doc>' 
00190         }; 
00191  
00192         // Parsing options 
00193  
00194         // Minimal parsing mode (equivalent to turning all other flags off). 
00195         // Only elements and PCDATA sections are added to the DOM tree, no text conversions are performed. 
00196         const unsigned int ParseMinimal = 0x0000; 
00197  
00198         // This flag determines if processing instructions (NodePi) are added to the DOM tree. This flag is off by default. 
00199         const unsigned int ParsePi = 0x0001; 
00200  
00201         // This flag determines if comments (NodeComment) are added to the DOM tree. This flag is off by default. 
00202         const unsigned int ParseComments = 0x0002; 
00203  
00204         // This flag determines if CDATA sections (NodeCdata) are added to the DOM tree. This flag is on by default. 
00205         const unsigned int ParseCdata = 0x0004; 
00206  
00207         // This flag determines if plain character data (NodePcdata) that consist only of whitespace are added to the DOM tree. 
00208         // This flag is off by default; turning it on usually results in slower parsing and more memory consumption. 
00209         const unsigned int ParseWsPcdata = 0x0008; 
00210  
00211         // This flag determines if character and entity references are expanded during parsing. This flag is on by default. 
00212         const unsigned int ParseEscapes = 0x0010; 
00213  
00214         // This flag determines if EOL characters are normalized (converted to #xA) during parsing. This flag is on by default. 
00215         const unsigned int ParseEol = 0x0020; 
00216          
00217         // This flag determines if attribute values are normalized using CDATA normalization rules during parsing. This flag is on by default. 
00218         const unsigned int ParseWconvAttribute = 0x0040; 
00219  
00220         // This flag determines if attribute values are normalized using NMTOKENS normalization rules during parsing. This flag is off by default. 
00221         const unsigned int ParseWnormAttribute = 0x0080; 
00222          
00223         // This flag determines if document declaration (NodeDeclaration) is added to the DOM tree. This flag is off by default. 
00224         const unsigned int ParseDeclaration = 0x0100; 
00225  
00226         // This flag determines if document type declaration (NodeDoctype) is added to the DOM tree. This flag is off by default. 
00227         const unsigned int ParseDoctype = 0x0200; 
00228  
00229         // The default parsing mode. 
00230         // Elements, PCDATA and CDATA sections are added to the DOM tree, character/reference entities are expanded, 
00231         // End-of-Line characters are normalized, attribute values are normalized using CDATA normalization rules. 
00232         const unsigned int ParseDefault = ParseCdata | ParseEscapes | ParseWconvAttribute | ParseEol; 
00233  
00234         // The full parsing mode. 
00235         // Nodes of all types are added to the DOM tree, character/reference entities are expanded, 
00236         // End-of-Line characters are normalized, attribute values are normalized using CDATA normalization rules. 
00237         const unsigned int ParseFull = ParseDefault | ParsePi | ParseComments | ParseDeclaration | ParseDoctype; 
00238  
00239         // These flags determine the DocumentEncoding of input data for XML document 
00240         enum Encoding 
00241         { 
00242                 EncodingAuto,     // Auto-detect input DocumentEncoding using BOM or < / <? detection; use UTF8 if BOM is not found 
00243                 EncodingUTF8,     // UTF8 DocumentEncoding 
00244                 EncodingUTF16LE,  // Little-endian UTF16 
00245                 EncodingUTF16BE,  // Big-endian UTF16 
00246                 EncodingUTF16,   // UTF16 with native endianness 
00247                 EncodingUTF32LE,  // Little-endian UTF32 
00248                 EncodingUTF32BE,  // Big-endian UTF32 
00249                 EncodingUTF32,   // UTF32 with native endianness 
00250                 Encodingwchar_t   // The same DocumentEncoding wchar_t has (either UTF16 or UTF32) 
00251         }; 
00252  
00253         // Formatting flags 
00254          
00255         // Indent the nodes that are written to output stream with as many indentation strings as deep the node is in DOM tree. This flag is on by default. 
00256         const unsigned int FormatIndent = 0x01; 
00257          
00258         // Write DocumentEncoding-specific BOM to the output stream. This flag is off by default. 
00259         const unsigned int FormatWriteBom = 0x02; 
00260  
00261         // Use raw output mode (no indentation and no line breaks are written). This flag is off by default. 
00262         const unsigned int FormatRaw = 0x04; 
00263          
00264         // Omit default XML declaration even if there is no declaration in the document. This flag is off by default. 
00265         const unsigned int FormatNoDeclaration = 0x08; 
00266  
00267         // The default set of formatting flags. 
00268         // Nodes are indented depending on their depth in DOM tree, a default declaration is output if document has none. 
00269         const unsigned int FormatDefault = FormatIndent;

00289         // Writer interface for node printing (see Node::print) 
00290         class PHYS_LIB Writer 
00291         { 
00292         public: 
00293                 virtual ~Writer() {} 
00294  
00295                 // Write memory chunk into stream/file/whatever 
00296                 virtual void write(const void* data, size_t size) = 0; 
00297         }; 
00298  
00299         // Writer implementation for FILE* 
00300         class PHYS_LIB WriterFile: public Writer 
00301         { 
00302         public: 
00303                 // Construct writer from a FILE* object; void* is used to avoid header dependencies on stdio 
00304                 WriterFile(void* file); 
00305  
00306                 virtual void write(const void* data, size_t size); 
00307  
00308         private: 
00309                 void* file; 
00310         };

00313         // Writer implementation for streams 
00314         class PHYS_LIB WriterStream: public Writer 
00315         { 
00316         public: 
00317                 // Construct writer from an output stream object 
00318                 WriterStream(std::basic_ostream<char, std::char_traits<char> >& stream); 
00319                 WriterStream(std::basic_ostream<wchar_t, std::char_traits<wchar_t> >& stream); 
00320  
00321                 virtual void write(const void* data, size_t size); 
00322  
00323         private: 
00324                 std::basic_ostream<char, std::char_traits<char> >* narrow_stream; 
00325                 std::basic_ostream<wchar_t, std::char_traits<wchar_t> >* wide_stream; 
00326         }; 
00327         #endif

00329         // A light-weight handle for manipulating attributes in DOM tree 
00330         class PHYS_LIB Attribute 
00331         { 
00332                 friend class AttributeIterator; 
00333                 friend class Node; 
00334  
00335         private: 
00336                 AttributeStruct* _attr; 
00337          
00338                 typedef AttributeStruct* Attribute::*unspecified_bool_type; 
00339  
00340         public: 
00341                 // Default constructor. Constructs an empty attribute. 
00342                 Attribute(); 
00343                  
00344                 // Constructs attribute from internal pointer 
00345                 explicit Attribute(AttributeStruct* attr); 
00346  
00347                 // Safe bool conversion operator 
00348                 operator unspecified_bool_type() const; 
00349  
00350                 // Borland C++ workaround 
00351                 bool operator!() const; 
00352  
00353                 // Comparison operators (compares wrapped attribute pointers) 
00354                 bool operator==(const Attribute& r) const; 
00355                 bool operator!=(const Attribute& r) const; 
00356                 bool operator<(const Attribute& r) const; 
00357                 bool operator>(const Attribute& r) const; 
00358                 bool operator<=(const Attribute& r) const; 
00359                 bool operator>=(const Attribute& r) const; 
00360  
00361                 // Check if attribute is empty 
00362                 bool empty() const; 
00363  
00364                 // Get attribute name/value, or "" if attribute is empty 
00365                 const char_t* name() const; 
00366                 const char_t* value() const; 
00367  
00368                 // Get attribute value as a number, or 0 if conversion did not succeed or attribute is empty 
00369                 int as_int() const; 
00370                 unsigned int as_uint() const; 
00371                 double as_double() const; 
00372                 float as_float() const; 
00373  
00374                 // Get attribute value as bool (returns true if first character is in '1tTyY' set), or false if attribute is empty 
00375                 bool as_bool() const; 
00376  
00377                 // Set attribute name/value (returns false if attribute is empty or there is not enough memory) 
00378                 bool set_name(const char_t* rhs); 
00379                 bool set_value(const char_t* rhs); 
00380  
00381                 // Set attribute value with type conversion (numbers are converted to strings, boolean is converted to "true"/"false") 
00382                 bool set_value(int rhs); 
00383                 bool set_value(unsigned int rhs); 
00384                 bool set_value(double rhs); 
00385                 bool set_value(bool rhs); 
00386  
00387                 // Set attribute value (equivalent to set_value without error checking) 
00388                 Attribute& operator=(const char_t* rhs); 
00389                 Attribute& operator=(int rhs); 
00390                 Attribute& operator=(unsigned int rhs); 
00391                 Attribute& operator=(double rhs); 
00392                 Attribute& operator=(bool rhs); 
00393  
00394                 // Get next/previous attribute in the attribute list of the parent node 
00395                 Attribute next_attribute() const; 
00396                 Attribute previous_attribute() const; 
00397  
00398                 // Get hash value (unique for handles to the same object) 
00399                 size_t hash_value() const; 
00400  
00401                 // Get internal pointer 
00402                 AttributeStruct* internal_object() const; 
00403         }; 
00404

00406         // Borland C++ workaround 
00407         bool PHYS_LIB operator&&(const Attribute& lhs, bool rhs); 
00408         bool PHYS_LIB operator||(const Attribute& lhs, bool rhs); 
00409 #endif

00411         // A light-weight handle for manipulating nodes in DOM tree 
00412         class PHYS_LIB Node 
00413         { 
00414                 friend class AttributeIterator; 
00415                 friend class NodeIterator; 
00416  
00417         protected: 
00418                 NodeStruct* _root; 
00419  
00420                 typedef NodeStruct* Node::*unspecified_bool_type; 
00421  
00422         public: 
00423                 // Default constructor. Constructs an empty node. 
00424                 Node(); 
00425  
00426                 // Constructs node from internal pointer 
00427                 explicit Node(NodeStruct* p); 
00428  
00429                 // Safe bool conversion operator 
00430                 operator unspecified_bool_type() const; 
00431  
00432                 // Borland C++ workaround 
00433                 bool operator!() const; 
00434          
00435                 // Comparison operators (compares wrapped node pointers) 
00436                 bool operator==(const Node& r) const; 
00437                 bool operator!=(const Node& r) const; 
00438                 bool operator<(const Node& r) const; 
00439                 bool operator>(const Node& r) const; 
00440                 bool operator<=(const Node& r) const; 
00441                 bool operator>=(const Node& r) const; 
00442  
00443                 // Check if node is empty. 
00444                 bool empty() const; 
00445  
00446                 // Get node type 
00447                 NodeType type() const; 
00448  
00449                 // Get node name/value, or "" if node is empty or it has no name/value 
00450                 const char_t* name() const; 
00451                 const char_t* value() const; 
00452          
00453                 // Get attribute list 
00454                 Attribute first_attribute() const; 
00455                 Attribute last_attribute() const; 
00456  
00457                 // Get children list 
00458                 Node first_child() const; 
00459                 Node last_child() const; 
00460  
00461                 // Get next/previous sibling in the children list of the parent node 
00462                 Node next_sibling() const; 
00463                 Node previous_sibling() const; 
00464                  
00465                 // Get parent node 
00466                 Node parent() const; 
00467  
00468                 // Get root of DOM tree this node belongs to 
00469                 Node root() const; 
00470  
00471                 // Get child, attribute or next/previous sibling with the specified name 
00472                 Node child(const char_t* name) const; 
00473                 Attribute attribute(const char_t* name) const; 
00474                 Node next_sibling(const char_t* name) const; 
00475                 Node previous_sibling(const char_t* name) const; 
00476  
00477                 // Get child value of current node; that is, value of the first child node of type PCDATA/CDATA 
00478                 const char_t* child_value() const; 
00479  
00480                 // Get child value of child with specified name. Equivalent to child(name).child_value(). 
00481                 const char_t* child_value(const char_t* name) const; 
00482  
00483                 // Set node name/value (returns false if node is empty, there is not enough memory, or node can not have name/value) 
00484                 bool set_name(const char_t* rhs); 
00485                 bool set_value(const char_t* rhs); 
00486                  
00487                 // Add attribute with specified name. Returns added attribute, or empty attribute on errors. 
00488                 Attribute append_attribute(const char_t* name); 
00489                 Attribute prepend_attribute(const char_t* name); 
00490                 Attribute insert_attribute_after(const char_t* name, const Attribute& attr); 
00491                 Attribute insert_attribute_before(const char_t* name, const Attribute& attr); 
00492  
00493                 // Add a copy of the specified attribute. Returns added attribute, or empty attribute on errors. 
00494                 Attribute append_copy(const Attribute& proto); 
00495                 Attribute prepend_copy(const Attribute& proto); 
00496                 Attribute insert_copy_after(const Attribute& proto, const Attribute& attr); 
00497                 Attribute insert_copy_before(const Attribute& proto, const Attribute& attr); 
00498  
00499                 // Add child node with specified type. Returns added node, or empty node on errors. 
00500                 Node append_child(NodeType type = NodeElement); 
00501                 Node prepend_child(NodeType type = NodeElement); 
00502                 Node insert_child_after(NodeType type, const Node& node); 
00503                 Node insert_child_before(NodeType type, const Node& node); 
00504  
00505                 // Add child element with specified name. Returns added node, or empty node on errors. 
00506                 Node append_child(const char_t* name); 
00507                 Node prepend_child(const char_t* name); 
00508                 Node insert_child_after(const char_t* name, const Node& node); 
00509                 Node insert_child_before(const char_t* name, const Node& node); 
00510  
00511                 // Add a copy of the specified node as a child. Returns added node, or empty node on errors. 
00512                 Node append_copy(const Node& proto); 
00513                 Node prepend_copy(const Node& proto); 
00514                 Node insert_copy_after(const Node& proto, const Node& node); 
00515                 Node insert_copy_before(const Node& proto, const Node& node); 
00516  
00517                 // Remove specified attribute 
00518                 bool remove_attribute(const Attribute& a); 
00519                 bool remove_attribute(const char_t* name); 
00520  
00521                 // Remove specified child 
00522                 bool remove_child(const Node& n); 
00523                 bool remove_child(const char_t* name); 
00524  
00525                 // Find attribute using predicate. Returns first attribute for which predicate returned true. 
00526                 template <typename Predicate> Attribute find_attribute(Predicate pred) const 
00527                 { 
00528                         if (!_root) return Attribute(); 
00529                          
00530                         for (Attribute attrib = first_attribute(); attrib; attrib = attrib.next_attribute()) 
00531                                 if (pred(attrib)) 
00532                                         return attrib; 
00533                  
00534                         return Attribute(); 
00535                 } 
00536  
00537                 // Find child node using predicate. Returns first child for which predicate returned true. 
00538                 template <typename Predicate> Node find_child(Predicate pred) const 
00539                 { 
00540                         if (!_root) return Node(); 
00541          
00542                         for (Node node = first_child(); node; node = node.next_sibling()) 
00543                                 if (pred(node)) 
00544                                         return node; 
00545                  
00546                         return Node(); 
00547                 } 
00548  
00549                 // Find node from subtree using predicate. Returns first node from subtree (depth-first), for which predicate returned true. 
00550                 template <typename Predicate> Node find_node(Predicate pred) const 
00551                 { 
00552                         if (!_root) return Node(); 
00553  
00554                         Node cur = first_child(); 
00555                          
00556                         while (cur._root && cur._root != _root) 
00557                         { 
00558                                 if (pred(cur)) return cur; 
00559  
00560                                 if (cur.first_child()) cur = cur.first_child(); 
00561                                 else if (cur.next_sibling()) cur = cur.next_sibling(); 
00562                                 else 
00563                                 { 
00564                                         while (!cur.next_sibling() && cur._root != _root) cur = cur.parent(); 
00565  
00566                                         if (cur._root != _root) cur = cur.next_sibling(); 
00567                                 } 
00568                         } 
00569  
00570                         return Node(); 
00571                 } 
00572  
00573                 // Find child node by attribute name/value 
00574                 Node find_child_by_attribute(const char_t* name, const char_t* attr_name, const char_t* attr_value) const; 
00575                 Node find_child_by_attribute(const char_t* attr_name, const char_t* attr_value) const;

00600

00602                 // Print subtree to stream 
00603                 void print(std::basic_ostream<char, std::char_traits<char> >& os, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = FormatDefault, Encoding DocumentEncoding = EncodingAuto, unsigned int depth = 0) const; 
00604                 void print(std::basic_ostream<wchar_t, std::char_traits<wchar_t> >& os, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = FormatDefault, unsigned int depth = 0) const; 
00605         #endif 
00606  
00607                 // Child nodes iterators 
00608                 typedef NodeIterator iterator; 
00609  
00610                 iterator begin() const; 
00611                 iterator end() const; 
00612  
00613                 // Attribute iterators 
00614                 typedef AttributeIterator attribute_iterator; 
00615  
00616                 attribute_iterator attributes_begin() const; 
00617                 attribute_iterator attributes_end() const; 
00618  
00619                 // Get node Offset in parsed file/string (in char_t units) for debugging purposes 
00620                 ptrdiff_t Offset_debug() const; 
00621  
00622                 // Get hash value (unique for handles to the same object) 
00623                 size_t hash_value() const; 
00624  
00625                 // Get internal pointer 
00626                 NodeStruct* internal_object() const; 
00627         }; 
00628  
00629 #ifdef __BORLANDC__ 
00630         // Borland C++ workaround 
00631         bool PHYS_LIB operator&&(const Node& lhs, bool rhs); 
00632         bool PHYS_LIB operator||(const Node& lhs, bool rhs); 
00633 #endif

00635         // Child node iterator (a bidirectional iterator over a collection of Node)

00650                 typedef Node* pointer; 
00651                 typedef Node& reference;

00655         #endif

00658                 NodeIterator();

00719         // Abstract tree walker class (see Node::traverse) 
00720         class PHYS_LIB TreeWalker 
00721         { 
00722                 friend class Node; 
00723  
00724         private: 
00725                 int _depth; 
00726          
00727         protected: 
00728                 // Get current traversal depth 
00729                 int depth() const; 
00730          
00731         public: 
00732                 TreeWalker(); 
00733                 virtual ~TreeWalker(); 
00734  
00735                 // Callback that is called when traversal begins 
00736                 virtual bool begin(Node& node); 
00737  
00738                 // Callback that is called for each node traversed 
00739                 virtual bool for_each(Node& node) = 0; 
00740  
00741                 // Callback that is called when traversal ends 
00742                 virtual bool end(Node& node); 
00743         }; 
00744  
00745         // Parsing Status, returned as part of ParseResult object 
00746         enum ParseStatus 
00747         { 
00748                 StatusOk = 0,                     // No error 
00749  
00750                 StatusFileNotFound,       // File was not found during load_file() 
00751                 StatusIOError,                  // Error reading from file/stream 
00752                 StatusOutOfMemory,         // Could not allocate memory 
00753                 StatusInternalError,      // Internal error occurred 
00754  
00755                 StatusUnrecognizedTag,  // Parser could not determine tag type 
00756  
00757                 StatusBadPi,                      // Parsing error occurred while parsing document declaration/processing instruction 
00758                 StatusBadComment,                // Parsing error occurred while parsing comment 
00759                 StatusBadCdata,            // Parsing error occurred while parsing CDATA section 
00760                 StatusBadDoctype,                // Parsing error occurred while parsing document type declaration 
00761                 StatusBadPcdata,                  // Parsing error occurred while parsing PCDATA section 
00762                 StatusBadStartElement,   // Parsing error occurred while parsing start element tag 
00763                 StatusBadAttribute,        // Parsing error occurred while parsing element attribute 
00764                 StatusBadEndElement,     // Parsing error occurred while parsing end element tag 
00765                 StatusEndElementMismatch // There was a mismatch of start-end tags (closing tag had incorrect name, some tag was not closed or there was an excessive closing tag) 
00766         }; 
00767  
00768         // Parsing result 
00769         struct PHYS_LIB ParseResult 
00770         { 
00771                 /// @brief Parsing status ( see @ref ParseStatus ) 
00772                 ParseStatus Status; 
00773  
00774                 /// @brief Last parsed offset (in char_t units from start of input data) 
00775                 ptrdiff_t Offset; 
00776  
00777                 /// @brief Source document encoding ( see @ref Encoding ) 
00778                 Encoding DocumentEncoding; 
00779  
00780                 /// @brief Default constructor, initializes object to failed state. 
00781                 ParseResult(); 
00782  
00783                 /// @brief Cast to bool operator 
00784                 /// @return This returns true if the ParseResult::Status member is set to ParseStatus::StatusOk, otherwise this returns false. 
00785                 operator bool() const; 
00786  
00787                 /// @brief Uses the Status member to create a text description. 
00788                 /// @return A const char* with a brief error description based on the ParseResult::Status 
00789                 const char* Description() const; 
00790         }; 
00791  
00792         // Document class (DOM tree root) 
00793         class PHYS_LIB Document: public Node 
00794         { 
00795         private: 
00796                 char_t* _buffer; 
00797  
00798                 char _memory[192]; 
00799                  
00800                 // Non-copyable semantics 
00801                 Document(const Document&); 
00802                 const Document& operator=(const Document&); 
00803  
00804                 void create(); 
00805                 void destroy(); 
00806  
00807                 ParseResult load_buffer_impl(void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options, Encoding DocumentEncoding, bool is_mutable, bool own); 
00808  
00809         public: 
00810                 // Default constructor, makes empty document 
00811                 Document(); 
00812  
00813                 // Destructor, invalidates all node/attribute handles to this document 
00814                 ~Document(); 
00815  
00816                 // Removes all nodes, leaving the empty document 
00817                 void reset(); 
00818  
00819                 // Removes all nodes, then copies the entire contents of the specified document 
00820                 void reset(const Document& proto); 
00821  
00822         #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
00823                 // Load document from stream. 
00824                 ParseResult load(std::basic_istream<char, std::char_traits<char> >& stream, unsigned int options = ParseDefault, Encoding DocumentEncoding = EncodingAuto); 
00825                 ParseResult load(std::basic_istream<wchar_t, std::char_traits<wchar_t> >& stream, unsigned int options = ParseDefault); 
00826         #endif 
00827  
00828                 // Load document from zero-terminated string. No DocumentEncoding conversions are applied. 
00829                 ParseResult load(const char_t* contents, unsigned int options = ParseDefault); 
00830  
00831                 // Load document from file 
00832                 ParseResult load_file(const char* path, unsigned int options = ParseDefault, Encoding DocumentEncoding = EncodingAuto); 
00833                 ParseResult load_file(const wchar_t* path, unsigned int options = ParseDefault, Encoding DocumentEncoding = EncodingAuto); 
00834  
00835                 // Load document from buffer. Copies/converts the buffer, so it may be deleted or changed after the function returns. 
00836                 ParseResult load_buffer(const void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options = ParseDefault, Encoding DocumentEncoding = EncodingAuto); 
00837  
00838                 // Load document from buffer, using the buffer for in-place parsing (the buffer is modified and used for storage of document data). 
00839                 // You should ensure that buffer data will persist throughout the document's lifetime, and free the buffer memory manually once document is destroyed. 
00840                 ParseResult load_buffer_inplace(void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options = ParseDefault, Encoding DocumentEncoding = EncodingAuto); 
00841  
00842                 // Load document from buffer, using the buffer for in-place parsing (the buffer is modified and used for storage of document data). 
00843                 // You should allocate the buffer with pugixml allocation function; document will free the buffer when it is no longer needed (you can't use it anymore). 
00844                 ParseResult load_buffer_inplace_own(void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options = ParseDefault, Encoding DocumentEncoding = EncodingAuto); 
00845  
00846                 // Save XML document to writer (semantics is slightly different from Node::print, see documentation for details). 
00847                 void save(Writer& writer, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = FormatDefault, Encoding DocumentEncoding = EncodingAuto) const; 
00848  
00849         #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
00850                 // Save XML document to stream (semantics is slightly different from Node::print, see documentation for details). 
00851                 void save(std::basic_ostream<char, std::char_traits<char> >& stream, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = FormatDefault, Encoding DocumentEncoding = EncodingAuto) const; 
00852                 void save(std::basic_ostream<wchar_t, std::char_traits<wchar_t> >& stream, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = FormatDefault) const; 
00853         #endif 
00854  
00855                 // Save XML to file 
00856                 bool save_file(const char* path, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = FormatDefault, Encoding DocumentEncoding = EncodingAuto) const; 
00857                 bool save_file(const wchar_t* path, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = FormatDefault, Encoding DocumentEncoding = EncodingAuto) const; 
00858  
00859                 // Get document element 
00860                 Node document_element() const; 
00861         };

00864         // XPath query return type 
00865         enum xpath_value_type 
00866         { 
00867                 xpath_type_none,          // Unknown type (query failed to compile) 
00868                 xpath_type_NodeSet,  // Node set (xpath_NodeSet) 
00869                 xpath_type_number,      // Number 
00870                 xpath_type_string,      // String 
00871                 xpath_type_boolean      // Boolean 
00872         };

00874         // XPath parsing result 
00875         struct PHYS_LIB xpath_ParseResult 
00876         { 
00877                 // Error message (0 if no error) 
00878                 const char* error; 
00879  
00880                 // Last parsed Offset (in char_t units from string start) 
00881                 ptrdiff_t Offset; 
00882  
00883                 /// @brief Default constructor, initializes object to failed state. 
00884                 xpath_ParseResult(); 
00885  
00886                 /// @brief Cast to bool operator 
00887                 /// @return This returns true if the ParseResult::Status member is set to ParseStatus::StatusOk, otherwise this returns false. 
00888                 operator bool() const; 
00889  
00890                 /// @brief Uses the Status member to create a text description. 
00891                 /// @return A const char* with a brief error description based on the ParseResult::Status 
00892                 const char* Description() const; 
00893         };

00895         // A single XPath variable 
00896         class PHYS_LIB xpath_variable 
00897         { 
00898                 friend class xpath_variable_set; 
00899  
00900         protected: 
00901                 xpath_value_type _type; 
00902                 xpath_variable* _next; 
00903  
00904                 xpath_variable(); 
00905  
00906                 // Non-copyable semantics 
00907                 xpath_variable(const xpath_variable&); 
00908                 xpath_variable& operator=(const xpath_variable&); 
00909                  
00910         public: 
00911                 // Get variable name 
00912                 const char_t* name() const; 
00913  
00914                 // Get variable type 
00915                 xpath_value_type type() const; 
00916  
00917                 // Get variable value; no type conversion is performed, default value (false, NaN, empty string, empty node set) is returned on type mismatch error 
00918                 bool get_boolean() const; 
00919                 double get_number() const; 
00920                 const char_t* get_string() const; 
00921                 const xpath_NodeSet& get_NodeSet() const; 
00922  
00923                 // Set variable value; no type conversion is performed, false is returned on type mismatch error 
00924                 bool set(bool value); 
00925                 bool set(double value); 
00926                 bool set(const char_t* value); 
00927                 bool set(const xpath_NodeSet& value); 
00928         }; 
00929  
00930         // A set of XPath variables 
00931         class PHYS_LIB xpath_variable_set 
00932         { 
00933         private: 
00934                 xpath_variable* _data[64]; 
00935  
00936                 // Non-copyable semantics 
00937                 xpath_variable_set(const xpath_variable_set&); 
00938                 xpath_variable_set& operator=(const xpath_variable_set&); 
00939  
00940                 xpath_variable* find(const char_t* name) const; 
00941  
00942         public: 
00943                 // Default constructor/destructor 
00944                 xpath_variable_set(); 
00945                 ~xpath_variable_set(); 
00946  
00947                 // Add a new variable or get the existing one, if the types match 
00948                 xpath_variable* add(const char_t* name, xpath_value_type type); 
00949  
00950                 // Set value of an existing variable; no type conversion is performed, false is returned if there is no such variable or if types mismatch 
00951                 bool set(const char_t* name, bool value); 
00952                 bool set(const char_t* name, double value); 
00953                 bool set(const char_t* name, const char_t* value); 
00954                 bool set(const char_t* name, const xpath_NodeSet& value); 
00955  
00956                 // Get existing variable by name 
00957                 xpath_variable* get(const char_t* name); 
00958                 const xpath_variable* get(const char_t* name) const; 
00959         };

00961         // A compiled XPath query object 
00962         class PHYS_LIB xpath_query 
00963         { 
00964         private: 
00965                 void* _impl; 
00966                 xpath_ParseResult _result; 
00967  
00968                 typedef void* xpath_query::*unspecified_bool_type; 
00969  
00970                 // Non-copyable semantics 
00971                 xpath_query(const xpath_query&); 
00972                 xpath_query& operator=(const xpath_query&); 
00973  
00974         public: 
00975                 // Construct a compiled object from XPath expression. 
00976                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is not defined, throws xpath_exception on compilation errors. 
00977                 explicit xpath_query(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables = 0); 
00978  
00979                 // Destructor 
00980                 ~xpath_query(); 
00981  
00982                 // Get query expression return type 
00983                 xpath_value_type return_type() const; 
00984                  
00985                 // Evaluate expression as boolean value in the specified context; performs type conversion if necessary. 
00986                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is not defined, throws std::bad_alloc on out of memory errors. 
00987                 bool evaluate_boolean(const xpath_node& n) const; 
00988                  
00989                 // Evaluate expression as double value in the specified context; performs type conversion if necessary. 
00990                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is not defined, throws std::bad_alloc on out of memory errors. 
00991                 double evaluate_number(const xpath_node& n) const; 
00992                  
00993         #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
00994                 // Evaluate expression as string value in the specified context; performs type conversion if necessary. 
00995                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is not defined, throws std::bad_alloc on out of memory errors. 
00996                 string_t evaluate_string(const xpath_node& n) const; 
00997         #endif 
00998                  
00999                 // Evaluate expression as string value in the specified context; performs type conversion if necessary. 
01000                 // At most capacity characters are written to the destination buffer, full result size is returned (includes terminating zero). 
01001                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is not defined, throws std::bad_alloc on out of memory errors. 
01002                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is defined, returns empty  set instead. 
01003                 size_t evaluate_string(char_t* buffer, size_t capacity, const xpath_node& n) const; 
01004  
01005                 // Evaluate expression as node set in the specified context. 
01006                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is not defined, throws xpath_exception on type mismatch and std::bad_alloc on out of memory errors. 
01007                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is defined, returns empty node set instead. 
01008                 xpath_NodeSet evaluate_NodeSet(const xpath_node& n) const; 
01009  
01010                 // Get parsing result (used to get compilation errors in XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS mode) 
01011                 const xpath_ParseResult& result() const; 
01012  
01013                 // Safe bool conversion operator 
01014                 operator unspecified_bool_type() const; 
01015  
01016                 // Borland C++ workaround 
01017                 bool operator!() const; 
01018         };

01080         // A fixed-size collection of XPath nodes 
01081         class PHYS_LIB xpath_NodeSet 
01082         { 
01083         public: 
01084                 // Collection type 
01085                 enum type_t 
01086                 { 
01087                         type_unsorted,                  // Not ordered 
01088                         type_sorted,                    // Sorted by document order (ascending) 
01089                         type_sorted_reverse             // Sorted by document order (descending) 
01090                 }; 
01091                  
01092                 // Constant iterator type 
01093                 typedef const xpath_node* const_iterator; 
01094          
01095                 // Default constructor. Constructs empty set. 
01096                 xpath_NodeSet(); 
01097  
01098                 // Constructs a set from iterator range; data is not checked for duplicates and is not sorted according to provided type, so be careful 
01099                 xpath_NodeSet(const_iterator begin, const_iterator end, type_t type = type_unsorted); 
01100  
01101                 // Destructor 
01102                 ~xpath_NodeSet(); 
01103                  
01104                 // Copy constructor/assignment operator 
01105                 xpath_NodeSet(const xpath_NodeSet& ns); 
01106                 xpath_NodeSet& operator=(const xpath_NodeSet& ns); 
01107  
01108                 // Get collection type 
01109                 type_t type() const; 
01110                  
01111                 // Get collection size 
01112                 size_t size() const; 
01113  
01114                 // Indexing operator 
01115                 const xpath_node& operator[](size_t index) const; 
01116                  
01117                 // Collection iterators 
01118                 const_iterator begin() const; 
01119                 const_iterator end() const; 
01120  
01121                 // Sort the collection in ascending/descending order by document order 
01122                 void sort(bool reverse = false); 
01123                  
01124                 // Get first node in the collection by document order 
01125                 xpath_node first() const; 
01126                  
01127                 // Check if collection is empty 
01128                 bool empty() const; 
01129          
01130         private: 
01131                 type_t _type; 
01132                  
01133                 xpath_node _storage; 
01134                  
01135                 xpath_node* _begin; 
01136                 xpath_node* _end; 
01137  
01138                 void _assign(const_iterator begin, const_iterator end); 
01139         }; 
01140 #endif

01152         // Memory allocation function interface; returns pointer to allocated memory or NULL on failure 
01153         typedef void* (*allocation_function)(size_t size); 
01154          
01155         // Memory deallocation function interface 
01156         typedef void (*deallocation_function)(void* ptr); 
01157  
01158         // Override default memory management functions. All subsequent allocations/deallocations will be performed via supplied functions. 
01159         void PHYS_LIB set_memory_management_functions(allocation_function allocate, deallocation_function deallocate); 
01160          
01161         // Get current memory management functions 
01162         allocation_function PHYS_LIB get_memory_allocation_function(); 
01163         deallocation_function PHYS_LIB get_memory_deallocation_function(); 
01164 }
